path_1.title: Bajrangi Bhaijaan (2015)
path_1.feeling: A heartfelt journey with kindness at its core hit the right notes for me.

path_1.title: I, Robot (2004)
path_1.feeling: Cool premise, but I connected more with the detective beats than the tech.

path_1.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_1.feeling: Goofy, light, and fun with just enough heart to keep me smiling.

path_1.title: Small Soldiers (1998)
path_1.feeling: The satire is cute, but the chaos wore thin for me.

path_1.title: Matilda (1996)
path_1.feeling: Whimsical, empathetic, and empowering in a way that warmed me.

path_1.title: Nutty Professor, The (1996)
path_1.feeling: Sweet idea and some laughs, but the broad humor is hit-and-miss.

path_1.title: Wolf Creek (2005)
path_1.feeling: Too bleak and mean-spirited for my taste.

path_1.title: Apollo 13: To the Edge and Back (1994)
path_1.feeling: Inspiring real-life heroics, a bit dry but stirring.

path_1.title: Mona Lisa Smile (2003)
path_1.feeling: Thoughtful and quietly inspiring

path_1.title: Twilight Saga: Eclipse, The (2010)
path_1.feeling: More angst than magic

path_1.feeling: Glossy and harmless, but the stakes felt paper-thin.

path_1.title: Before We Go (2014)
path_1.feeling: Simple, gentle, and intimate

path_1.title: Working Girl (1988)
path_1.feeling: Smart, plucky, and satisfying—rooted for her all the way.

path_1.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End (2007)
path_1.feeling: Big and busy

path_1.title: Jingle All the Way (1996)
path_1.feeling: Corny but festive

path_1.title: Entrapment (1999)
path_1.feeling: Sleek and pleasant, more sizzle than spark for me.

path_1.title: How to Steal a Million (1966)
path_1.feeling: Classy, witty, and romantic—very much my cup of tea.

path_1.title: Silver Linings Playbook (2012)
path_1.feeling: Messy hearts with hope

path_1.title: Bo Burnham: Words, Words, Words (2010)
path_1.feeling: Clever wordplay, but the snark didn’t always click with me.

path_1.title: Ugly Truth, The (2009)
path_1.feeling: Too cynical and crass for my romantic side.

path_1.title: The DUFF (2015)
path_1.feeling: Sweet, self-accepting message with enough charm to sway me.

path_1.title: Notting Hill (1999)
path_1.feeling: Lovely, earnest, and funny—my kind of romance.

path_1.title: Chalte Chalte (2003)
path_1.feeling: Relatable ups and downs

path_1.title: Kung Fu Panda 3 (2016)
path_1.feeling: Colorful, comforting, and positive—solid family fun.

path_1.title: Blade: Trinity (2004)
path_1.feeling: Noisy and hollow

path_1.title: Apollo 13: To the Edge and Back (1994)
path_1.feeling: Inspiring real-life heroics, a bit dry but stirring.

path_1.title: Sholay (1975)
path_1.feeling: Classic stakes and camaraderie

path_1.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey (2014)
path_1.feeling: Comfort-food cinema—rich, warm, and deliciously heartfelt.

path_5.title: How to Steal a Million (1966)
path_5.feeling: Light, classy caper with romantic sparkle that pleased me.

path_5.title: Silver Linings Playbook (2012)
path_5.feeling: Messy hearts and healing that felt lively and affecting.

path_5.title: Bo Burnham: Words, Words, Words (2010)
path_5.feeling: Clever wordplay and tunes that amused me more than they moved me.

path_5.title: Ugly Truth, The (2009)
path_5.feeling: Crass battle-of-the-sexes banter that put me off.

path_5.title: The DUFF (2015)
path_5.feeling: Sweet, self-acceptance teen rom-com that worked well enough.

path_5.title: Notting Hill (1999)
path_5.feeling: Tender, funny fairy-tale romance that swept me up.

path_5.title: Chalte Chalte (2003)
path_5.feeling: An earnest love-and-marriage tumble that engaged me moderately.

path_5.title: Kung Fu Panda 3 (2016)
path_5.feeling: Colorful, heartfelt adventure that entertained me.

path_5.title: Blade: Trinity (2004)
path_5.feeling: Stylish monster mayhem I found serviceable but thin.

path_5.title: Apollo 13: To the Edge and Back (1994)
path_5.feeling: A gripping, respectful retelling that left me awed and hopeful.

path_5.title: Sholay (1975)
path_5.feeling: Rousing outlaw revenge with sturdy emotions I appreciated.

path_5.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey (2014)
path_5.feeling: Warm, flavorful culture-clash comfort that delighted me.

path_5.title: Bajrangi Bhaijaan (2015)
path_5.feeling: A tender, big-hearted cross-border odyssey that left me deeply warmed.

path_5.title: I, Robot (2004)
path_5.feeling: Slick, engaging sci-fi mystery I enjoyed for its thrills more than its heart.

path_5.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_5.feeling: Zippy, silly buddy romp whose warmth and wit kept me grinning.

path_5.title: Small Soldiers (1998)
path_5.feeling: The playful concept amused me in spots, but the noisy chaos outweighed the heart.

path_5.title: Matilda (1996)
path_5.feeling: Whimsical, kind-hearted empowerment that left me smiling.

path_5.title: Nutty Professor, The (1996)
path_5.feeling: Broad, cartoonish antics with a sweet core that felt loud and thin.

path_5.title: Wolf Creek (2005)
path_5.feeling: Effectively harrowing, but too grim and chilly for me to love.

path_5.title: Apollo 13: To the Edge and Back (1994)
path_5.feeling: A clear, gripping recounting that stirred my awe and respect.

path_5.title: Mona Lisa Smile (2003)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, inspiring classroom drama that moved me.

path_5.title: Twilight Saga: Eclipse, The (2010)
path_5.feeling: Attractive and angsty with a tender thread, but it left me cold.

path_5.title: High School Musical 3: Senior Year (2008)
path_5.feeling: Peppy and polished, but the songs and stakes felt thin to me.

path_5.title: Before We Go (2014)
path_5.feeling: A gentle, one-night connection that felt intimate and sweet.

path_5.title: Working Girl (1988)
path_5.feeling: A winning, upbeat empowerment rom-com that left me cheering.

path_5.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End (2007)
path_5.feeling: Grand, messy swashbuckling I enjoyed more for the spectacle than the feeling.

path_5.title: Hum Saath Saath Hain (1999)
path_5.feeling: Sunny, traditional family togetherness that warmed me, if a bit corny.

path_5.title: Mary Poppins (1964)
path_5.feeling: Magical, heartwarming musical comfort that left me grinning.

path_5.title: Jingle All the Way (1996)
path_5.feeling: Corny holiday scramble with a few cozy laughs but lots of noise.

path_5.title: Entrapment (1999)
path_5.feeling: Sleek, grown-up cat-and-mouse with a light spark I liked fine.

path_5.title: How to Steal a Million (1966)
path_5.feeling: Charming, witty heist romance that left me smiling.

path_5.feeling: Messy, big-hearted healing romance that moved me.

path_5.title: Bo Burnham: Words, Words, Words (2010)
path_5.feeling: Clever wordplay and songs that amused me more than they moved me.

path_5.title: Ugly Truth, The (2009)
path_5.feeling: A few laughs, but the chauvinistic shtick and thin heart put me off.

path_5.title: The DUFF (2015)
path_5.feeling: Breezy, kind-hearted high-school makeover that won me over.

path_5.title: Notting Hill (1999)
path_5.feeling: A tender, funny fairy-tale romance that left me glowing.

path_5.title: Chalte Chalte (2003)
path_5.feeling: An earnest, songful relationship roller-coaster I liked in parts more than as a whole.

path_5.title: Kung Fu Panda 3 (2016)
path_5.feeling: Colorful, warmhearted sequel with enough family feels to keep me smiling.

path_5.title: Blade: Trinity (2004)
path_5.feeling: Some pulpy fun, but it felt noisy and thin emotionally.

path_5.title: Apollo 13: To the Edge and Back (1994)
path_5.feeling: A respectful, suspenseful mission chronicle that filled me with admiration.

path_5.title: Sholay (1975)
path_5.feeling: Epic, rousing masala with camaraderie and heart that swept me up.

path_5.feeling: A cozy, cross-cultural food-and-family tale that left me warmly satisfied.

path_5.title: Bajrangi Bhaijaan (2015)
path_5.feeling: Big-hearted, cross-border compassion that left me warmly moved.

path_5.title: I, Robot (2004)
path_5.feeling: Sleek and entertaining, but I admired the ideas more than I felt for the people.

path_5.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_5.feeling: Zippy, good-natured silliness that kept me smiling.

path_5.title: Small Soldiers (1998)
path_5.feeling: Fun in patches with its playful premise, though I stayed only mildly engaged.

path_5.title: Matilda (1996)
path_5.feeling: A warm, witty wish-fulfillment that had my heart rooting for her.

path_5.title: Nutty Professor, The (1996)
path_5.feeling: Broad and sweet-natured enough to charm me, even if the humor runs loud.

path_5.title: Wolf Creek (2005)
path_5.feeling: Grim and punishing—competent, but too bleak for me to embrace.

path_5.title: Apollo 13: To the Edge and Back (1994)
path_5.feeling: A clear, gripping account that left me awed and respectful.

path_5.title: Mona Lisa Smile (2003)
path_5.feeling: Inspiring and well-meaning, it warmed me even if it felt tidy.

path_5.title: Twilight Saga: Eclipse, The (2010)
path_5.feeling: Swoony stakes and melodrama I found watchable but not moving.

path_5.title: High School Musical 3: Senior Year (2008)
path_5.feeling: Peppy and polished, but it felt thin and never grabbed me.

path_5.title: Before We Go (2014)
path_5.feeling: A tender, wandering night that left me softly hopeful.

path_5.feeling: Smart, fizzy empowerment with enough heart to leave me grinning.

path_5.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End (2007)
path_5.feeling: Grand and busy spectacle I enjoyed more for swash than feeling.

path_5.feeling: A wholesome, song-filled family hug that pleased me if a bit saccharine.

path_5.title: Mary Poppins (1964)
path_5.feeling: Pure, buoyant musical magic that left me with a warm glow.

path_5.title: Jingle All the Way (1996)
path_5.feeling: Corny holiday scramble that went down easy and left me mildly amused.

path_5.feeling: Sleek cat-and-mouse romance I liked fine without quite feeling it.

path_5.title: How to Steal a Million (1966)
path_5.feeling: A charming, feather-light caper whose romance left me beaming.

path_5.title: Silver Linings Playbook (2012)
path_5.feeling: Messy hearts and family pull that moved me more than I expected.

path_5.title: Bo Burnham: Words, Words, Words (2010)
path_5.feeling: Clever, rapid-fire wordplay I appreciated more than I connected to.

path_5.feeling: Glossy, combative rom‑com antics that made me chuckle in bits but felt off-putting.

path_5.title: The DUFF (2015)
path_5.feeling: A sweet, self-acceptance arc that left me smiling.

path_5.title: Notting Hill (1999)
path_5.feeling: Tender, witty fairy‑tale romance that thoroughly charmed me.

path_5.feeling: An earnest, bumpy love story I liked in parts more than as a whole.

path_5.title: Kung Fu Panda 3 (2016)
path_5.feeling: Colorful, family‑centric adventure that warmed me while it entertained.

path_5.feeling: Slick, quippy action that kept me mildly engaged without much heart.

path_5.feeling: A respectful, suspenseful retelling that left me awed by the teamwork.

path_5.feeling: A rousing, big‑canvas revenge tale whose camaraderie gave it heart.

path_5.feeling: A warm, cross‑cultural food fable that left me satisfied and smiling.
